metadata.Description: Buildings that are designed and constructed to have a minimal impact on the environment.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
A network of interconnected devices and systems that enable the efficient management and distribution of energy.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.

relations.Description: Green buildings implement energy efficiency policies that promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.
relations.Subject: green buildings

relations.Description: Green buildings provide funding for renewable energy projects to support the transition to clean energy sources.
relations.Subject: green buildings

relations.Description: Green buildings focus on sustainable construction practices that minimize environmental impact and promote resource efficiency.
relations.Subject: green buildings

relations.Description: Green buildings are located in urban areas to promote sustainable urban development and reduce carbon emissions.
relations.Subject: green buildings

relations.Description: Green buildings partner with architects and engineers to incorporate sustainable design principles and technologies.
relations.Subject: green buildings

relations.Description: Green buildings contribute to climate change mitigation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions and promoting energy efficiency.
relations.Subject: green buildings

relations.Description: Green buildings monitor energy consumption to identify areas for improvement and optimize energy efficiency.
relations.Subject: green buildings

relations.Description: Green buildings target net zero energy consumption by utilizing renewable energy sources and energy-efficient technologies.
relations.Subject: green buildings
energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

relations.Subject: internet of energy
relations.Description: The internet of energy implements the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote energy-saving practices and technologies.

relations.Subject: internet of energy
relations.Description: The internet of energy funds various renewable energy projects to support the transition to clean and sustainable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: renewable energy certificates
relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.
